# Teaching experience

## Courses

##### {{< fa calculator >}} [BIO2041. Biostatistique  1](https://admission.umontreal.ca/cours-et-horaires/cours/bio-2041/) 
Université de Montréal\

**Head teaching assistant:** Fall 2022\
**Teaching assistant:** Summer 2022 and Summer 2023\
**Tutor:** Summer 2020, Summer 2021, Summer 2022, Summer 2023\

*Biological statistics. Parameters of a distribution. Probability distributions. Confidence intervals. Decision theory. Comparison of two samples. Correlation. Analysis of variance. Chi-square tests. Regression*

<br>

##### {{< fa calculator >}} {{< fa calculator >}} [BIO2042. Biostatistique 2](https://admission.umontreal.ca/cours-et-horaires/cours/bio-2042/) 
Université de Montréal\

**Teaching assistant:** Winter 2023\
**Tutor:** Winter 2023\

*Advanced analysis of biological variation. Multiple regression, model II regression, multi-criteria classification and hierarchical ANOVA, analysis of covariance. Introduction to multivariate analysis.*

<br>

##### {{< fa fish-fins >}} [BIO2811. Dynamique des populations](https://admission.umontreal.ca/cours-et-horaires/cours/bio-2811/) 
Université de Montréal\

**Teaching assistant:** Winter 2021, Winter 2022\

*Processes responsible for temporal variations in the abundance of animal and plant populations. Description and use of mathematical models to quantify and predict variations in population abundance.*

<br>

##### {{< fa gears >}} [BIO1001. Méthodes de recherche en biologie (TP)](https://admission.umontreal.ca/cours-et-horaires/cours/bio-1001/) 
Université de Montréal\

**Teaching assistant:** Fall 2021\

*Presentation of the basic principles of research work, including laboratory practices, the use of libraries and bibliographic databases, and the acquisition, processing and presentation of scientific data.* 

<br>

##### {{< fa database >}} [BIO6065. École d'été en synthèse écologique de données](https://admission.umontreal.ca/cours-et-horaires/cours/bio-6065/) 
Université de Montréal\

**Teaching assistant:** Summer 2021\

*This one-week advanced training course will present, through projects, the most advanced data mining methods for working with ecological data.*

<br>

##### {{< fa circle-nodes >}} [BIO3043. Théorie des réseaux](https://admission.umontreal.ca/cours-et-horaires/cours/bio-3043/) 
Université de Montréal\

**Teaching assistant:** Fall 2020\

*Description of ecological communities from the perspective of network theory, structure of interactions between species, prediction of emergent properties of ecosystems, spatial and evolutionary dynamics of community structure. Note: It is strongly suggested that you have taken BIO2811 before enrolling in this course.*
